message: All metadata fields for the indicator 2-3-1, translated into en
data: Goal 2. End hunger, achieve food security, improve nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture2.3 By 2030, double the agricultural productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers, in particular women, indigenous people, family farmers, pastoralists and fishermen, including by ensuring equal access to land, other productive resources and factors of production, knowledge, financial services, markets and opportunities for value addition and non-agricultural employment2.3.1. Quantity of annual production (in tonnes)MINEAGRIEMBAZUMUTIMANA Dieudonne79548570dembaze@yahoo.frit is the ratio between the volume of agricultural production on the number of agricultural workers or the volume of agricultural labor hoursTon per workerNational Agricultural SurveyData are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaireThe probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)In 2021MINEAGRIEMINEAGRIE is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national levelThe Ministerial departments in charge of statistical production are members of the SSN and have a mandate to collect, process and disseminate official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.The indicator is relevant because it reflects the situation on plant and animal productionUpdating the indicator requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources and most of which is donated by partnersRatio of the volume of agricultural production to the number of agricultural workers or the volume of agricultural labor hours, expressed in tonnes per workerThe results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publicationThe indicator is available at national levelThe indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international levelReport of the National Survey of Agriculture in Burundi
